org.cove.jade.primitives
Class Particle

    java.lang.Object
    org.cove.jade.primitives.Particle
Direct Known Subclasses:
CircleParticle, RectangleParticle
public class Particle
extends java.lang.Object

Class implementing a particle (sometimes called a primitive in parts of JADE). Something that moves in the world and collides with surfaces. 

    JADE - JAva Dynamics Engine
    Release 0.6.1 alpha 2005-12-28
    Particle class

Collision resolution stuff

bounciness

    public double bounciness
Bounciness - how bouncy the particle is, 1 is default, greater than 1 is more bouncy, less than 1 is less bouncy (minimum of zero). Make this too bouncy and things become unstable. Do not make this less than zero! Yes I know this isn't quite the scientific term to use but springiness or elasticity won't work (lest it be confused with a SpringConstraint) ...

mass

    public double mass
Mass - extent to which particle is affected by gravity, 1 is the default, greater than 1 to be affected more, less than 1 to be affected less, less than zero to float. Note that this does not affect "momentum" (maybe that should be done later, as a sort of particle-specific damping factor?).

getAxisProjection

    public void getAxisProjection(GVector axis)
Get projection onto arbitrary axis. Note that axis need not be unit-length. If it is not, min and max will be scaled by the length of the axis. This is fine if all we're doing is comparing relative values. If we need the 'actual' projection, the axis should be unit length.

setMTD

    public void setMTD(double depthX,
    double depthY,
    double depthN,
    GVector surfNormal)
Find minimum depth and set mtd appropriately. mtd is the minimum translational distance, the vector along which we must move the box to resolve the collision.

setXYMTD

    public void setXYMTD(double depthX,
    double depthY)
Set the mtd for situations where there are only the x and y axes to consider.
